thread.title: North Charleston City 9
thread.title_full: Candidates for North Charleston City Council, District 9 - Post and Courier

author: postandcourier.com
title: North Charleston City 9
text:
David J. McDonough David J. McDonough Age: 49
Residence: Pine Valley subdivision, Wescott Plantation
Occupation: Retired NYC Fireman â€“ FDNY, currently South Carolina Fire Marshal at the College of Charleston.
Education: New York City Fire Academy
Political Experience: None
Contact Information: (843) 296-6795 , (843) 486-9488, damcd66@gmail.com , www.DavidJMcDonough.us
 I spend my spare time usually home working in the yard and when time permits, love being on the water fishing with my family.
 I have been engaged at all levels of our community from working with sitting council members to homeowners associations, and feel that I have the pulse of the community to hit the ground running if elected.
 The top priority for our area is traffic congestion and improving traffic infrastructure. With the continued growth in our area, a comprehensive traffic and growth study plan needs to be developed to provide a balance during the continued growth in our area.
Kenny Skipper Age: 50
Residence: Indigo Fields
Occupation: Director of Operations, CMC Logistics
Education: The Citadel, BS Business Administration; Central Michigan University, MS in Administration
 843-200-7520, klskipper@gmail.com , kennyskipper.com
 I spend time with my wife, son and daughter.
 I am involved. I have been president of the PTSA at FDHS. I have been on the North Charleston Recreation Board for 7 years. I am in touch with the residents.
 I would do my best to keep growth and infrastructure in balance. I would look at innovative ways to relieve traffic.
Nelson B. Rivers III Age: 64
Residence: Indigo Fields
Occupation: Pastor, Charity Missionary Baptist Church & VP Religious Affairs & External Relations, NAN
Education: Bachelor of Science, Wilberforce University, Ohio
 (843) 764-7856, nriversiii@gmail.com , rivers4council@gmail.com , www.riversforcouncil.org
 Reading, walking and watching ESPN
 I have worked 40 years in public service to achieve a demonstrated ability to work with diverse groups to successfully improve the lives of under served communities.
 Improve relationships between police and community, end traffic stop quotas and racial profiling by police, reduce traffic congestion and help create high use public transportation.
